results.title: The Ingrate
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: A young bank clerk’s love for the daughter of the bank’s president proves to be a dilemma which eventually turns into a disaster for one and all. Cast includes Herbert Yost, Florence Lawrence, Arthur V. Johnson.

results.title: The Industrial revolution
results.brief_description: Primitive humans employed animals to supplement their own strength and labour power, and this method of production has been common to all civilizations. Technological development which went hand in hand with the increase in the complexity of European civilization, particularly the development of machines, gradually replaced the labour-power of men and draught animals in many aspects of production. The social and economic implications of industrialisation are noted.

results.title: The Incas
results.brief_description: A historical, geographic and cultural view of Incan civilisation, shown by visits to authentic sites, archaelogical remains and existing Peruvian village life. The distinctive features of the Incan government and the economy based on agriculture and small industries and crafts. Includes re-enactment of the Incan worship of the pagan sun-god.

results.title: The Impressionists
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An explanation of the impressionist style and spirit is given. The film then follows chronologically, through the works of Monet, Manet, Pissarro, Sisley, Renoir and Degas, illustrating differences and similarities between them. Brushwork and style is examined.

results.title: The Impossible dream
results.creator_credit: Dagmar Doubkova, Peter Hollander and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film without narration about a family which operates within traditional stereotyped roles where the woman is mother, housekeeper and wage earner while the man is wage earner only. Shows how the children imitate their parents in these sex roles. A useful discussion starter in the area of sex role stereotyping. Suitable for middle and upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Importance of food safety
results.brief_description: This video is about how to safely handle and prepare food for public consumption. It is aimed at people who prepare food in the hospitality industry and other food handling professions, but contains useful tips to keep in mind when preparing food in the home. Discusses bacteria and how to lessen its effects, storage temperatures and conditions for food, both raw and cooked, freezing, thawing and cooking of food, delivery of food and how to lessen the likelihood of illness from improperly prepared food. Includes a questionnaire to test knowledge of content of video.

results.title: The Impersonation
results.brief_description: Since it first became known in 1974, the signature of the contemporary English ‘primitive’ painter, Reginald Pepper, has been gaining prominence amongst critics and collectors. It now appears that such a painter does not exist. This film presents an overview of the case of Reginald Pepper and also looks at the broader issues concerning ‘primitivism’ in art.

results.title: The Immigrant
results.creator_credit: Blackhawk Films and Van Beuren Corporation
results.brief_description: On their way to America, Charlie befriends a girl and her mother after an incident aboard ship. Later ashore they become involved in one of the funniest restaurant sequences ever filmed. One of the top Chaplin comedies of the mutual period. Cast also includes Edna Purviance, Eric Campbell, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman.

results.title: The Illustrated Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Jackie Farkas, Lucia Salinas Briones and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The voice of an Auschwitz survivor (voice provided by Zsuzsi Weinstock) is presented against a backdrop of images, both hopeful and tragic. She speaks of her childhood impressions, of a belief that she couldn’t avoid her fate and the impact of Hitler’s voice. Footage from “The Wizard of Oz” is juxtaposed against images of haystacks and has a personal significance to the narrator who wished she could go ‘home’, but realises she has none to go to.
